title: Doctoral student in physics-informed machine learning for time-series data
description:
Join us to develop physics-guided and data-driven foundation models for multivariate time series in safety-critical systems such as automotive. You will design predictive and generative models, scale training on real data, and validate in simulation and with industry partners to advance safe, reliable automation.

About us¬†
The Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Chalmers and University of Gothenburg in Sweden employs approximately 300 employees from more than 30 countries. The department is divided into four divisions and is widely recognized for excellent research and education, with activities on two campuses in the city of Gothenburg. Research in the department has a wide span, from theoretical foundations to applied systems development. We provide high quality education at the bachelor's, master's, and graduate levels, offering over 120 courses each year. We also have extensive national and international collaborations with academia, industry and society.

We are announcing a PhD position that is placed at the Computing Science division with Chalmers University of Technology as the employer.¬†

This project is a collaboration between the AIXLab@Chalmers¬†and Volvo Group. At AIXLab, we focus on developing AI solutions that are usable and applicable in real-world settings. We are part of the Computing Science division at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.

About the research project‚ÄØ¬†
This project advances physics-aware foundation models for time-series data. The primary use case is automotive: predicting vehicle behavior, simulating rare safety-critical scenarios and generating test cases to strengthen validation and reduce physical trials. The techniques are designed to transfer to other domains. You do not need extensive experience with physics-guided modeling; strong interest in time series machine learning and the ambition to learn are what matter most. The results will support safer automation, fewer failure modes, more efficient testing, and lower energy use.

Who we are looking for
The following requirements are mandatory:

‚Ä¢ To qualify as a Doctoral student, you must have a Master's degree (masterexamen) of 120 credits or a Master‚Äôs degree (magisterexamen) of 60 credits* in Computer Science, Electrical engineering, or equivalent.
‚Ä¢ You will need strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
‚Ä¢ Strong machine learning fundamentals (probability, statistics, optimization) and strong interest in time-series modeling and physics-guided machine learning.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Python and modern deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch).¬†
‚Ä¢ Engineering skills: GPU/cluster training, experiment tracking, data engineering.
‚Ä¢ Ability to formulate research questions, run empirical studies at scale.

*for students with an education earned outside of Sweden, a 4-year Bachelor‚Äôs degree is accepted.¬†

The following experience will strengthen your application:¬†

‚Ä¢ Experience with physics-informed machine learning
‚Ä¢ Background in foundation models for time-series (forecasting, representation learning)
‚Ä¢ Exposure to safety-critical systems, scenario generation, or test coverage for edge cases
‚Ä¢ Experience with academic research and publications

What you will do

‚Ä¢ Take courses at an advanced level within the Graduate school of Computer Science and Engineering
‚Ä¢ Develop your own scientific concepts and communicate the results of your research verbally and in writing

Contract terms¬†¬†

‚Ä¢ The Doctoral student positions are fully funded from start.¬†
‚Ä¢ The position is limited to four years, with the possibility to teach up to 20%, which extends the position to five years.¬†
‚Ä¢ A starting salary of 34,550 SEK per month (valid from May 25, 2025).¬†
‚Ä¢ Doctoral studies require physical presence throughout the entire study period. A valid residence permit must be presented by the study start date; otherwise the admission may be withdrawn.¬†

What we offer¬†

‚Ä¢ As a Doctoral student at Chalmers, you are an employee and enjoy all employee benefits. Read more about‚ÄØ¬†working at Chalmers‚ÄØ¬†and our‚ÄØbenefits‚ÄØfor employees.¬†
‚Ä¢ A dynamic and inspiring working environment in the coastal city of Gothenburg.¬†
‚Ä¢ Read more about Sweden‚Äôs generous parental leave, subsidized day care, free schools, healthcare etc at Move To Gothenburg.¬†

Chalmers is dedicated to improving gender balance and actively works with equality projects, such as the GENIE Initiative for gender equality and excellence. We celebrate diversity and consider equality and inclusion as fundamental aspects of all our activities.¬†

title: PLM Solution Architect
description:

Your Role

title: Data Warehouse Engineer
description:
About Us
Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfilment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travellers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve exclusively Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights and TUI.
Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 3000 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry‚Äôs tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Greece, India, Canada, Poland and Uruguay.
Do you want to be part of the next step in our growth journey?
At Etraveli Group we use a lot of data for decision making processes, analysis and machine learning. Users of the data can be found in different departments like Finance, Customer Service, Sales, Data Science and Research. In alignment with our growing targets we are looking for experienced data engineers to become part of our Data Solutions team to get more data into our data lakehouse platform and prepare it in order to be used by the users. 
Who You Are
With the right skill set and motivation you will be setting up, maintaining and evolving our data warehouse solution as well as participating in driving a large portion of our future data engineering.
In this primarily technical role, there will be close interaction with database administrators and operations‚Äô engineers, but there will also be collaboration with stakeholders from other parts of our organization (e.g data analysts, business intelligence teams and business stakeholders). The data sources we use are located both in cloud environments as well as on-prem. Working with us means you'll have access to a team of highly competent professionals and ample resources to foster your personal and professional growth. We face the challenges of the day working for a company that goes the extra mile to ensure that we have fun at, and outside, the office. 
Requirements
To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you have:
A strong interest in maintain and evolve our data warehouse solution
Ability to analyze and take on tasks, both individually and together with others
Ability to design and implement tasks from scratch, individually gathering the necessary information where needed
Strong foundation in data warehousing concepts and data modeling (e.g., Star and Snowflake Schemas, Incremental Loads, Slowly Changing Dimensions)
Previous experience working with data processing and distributed query engines, like Spark, Dremio/Trino, Databricks
Previous experience working as a data engineer, with different ETL (e.g., dbt, Airflow) and CDC tools (e.g., Debezium, Flink CDC, Kafka Connect)
Previous experience working with multiple scripting languages, like Bash, Python, SQL, etc

It is also desirable that your skills match one or more of the following:
Previous experience to ensure high-performance data processing with techniques like indexing, partitioning, and caching.
Previous experience working with data integrations
Previous experience working with data modelling for efficient query performance, data quality and optimization
Previous experience working as a database administrator
Comfortable working with Linux, Docker, and preferably also Kubernetes
Experience with data lakehouse table formats like Apache Iceberg or Delta Lake, enabling features like ACID transactions and time-travel on object storage

Benefits
At Etraveli Technology, you will be part of a gang of +200 people, all with different cutting-edge skills and personalities. We believe that it is precisely the differences that make us a good team because we share the same ambition - we strive for the same goals, are passionate about what we do and work hard.
Etraveli Group is a company that really wants to contribute to you reaching your full potential.
Our brand new office is located in Merkurhuset in Gothenburg, a stone's throw from public transport and lunch restaurants.
We love gaming and after work activities.
We know the value of personal development and continuous training.
Hackathons and Dev Weeks - We believe in promoting creativity and trying new things.
Wellness allowance - Each employee receives a maximum allowable amount each year according to the Swedish Tax Agency to spend on health-promoting activities.
Through partners, we offer comprehensive pension and health insurance so that you can quickly get help if the accident occurs.
We have a hybrid working model so once you are onboarded you have the flexibility to work from home two days a week.
And we serve breakfast every morning.

At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds. During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.
Welcome to Etraveli Group.
As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.
